content.text: 0) In a mixing bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "cream"@21:26 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "butter"@27:33 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "confectioners' sugar"@38:58 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "a mixing bowl"@6:19 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 3) With lightly floured hands, shape tablespoonfuls of batter into cookies.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "shape"@31:36 / AC
		:ppt ( "tablespoonfuls of batter"@37:61 / FOOD )
		:reshape ( "cookies"@67:74 / FOOD )
		:instrument ( tool-3-0 "lightly floured hands"@8:29 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 4) Place cookies apart on ungreased baking sheets.
5) Bake at 350 degrees F for 9-11 minutes or until edges and bottom are lightly browned.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "Bake"@3:7 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:heat ( temp-5-0 "350 degrees F"@11:24 / TEMPERATURE )
		:duration ( dur-5-0 "9-11 minutes"@29:41 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-5-0 "until edges and bottom are lightly browned"@45:87 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 6) Cool for 2-3 minutes before removing to wire racks.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "Cool"@3:7 / AC
		:duration ( dur-6-0 "2-3 minutes"@12:23 / DUR )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:duration ( cond-6-0 "before removing to wire racks"@24:53 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 7) In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate chips and shortening; stir until smooth.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "melt"@29:33 / AC
		:loc ( tool-7-0 "a microwave-safe bowl"@6:27 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "chocolate chips"@34:49 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "shortening"@54:64 / FOOD )
	)
	:inform ( ac-7-1 "stir"@66:70 / AC
		:until ( cond-7-0 "until smooth"@71:83 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 8) Drizzle chocolate over half of the cookies.
9) Dip one end of remaining cookies into chocolate, then sprinkle with walnuts.
